intro: Vateria lanceolaria, commonly known as the lanceolate vateria, is a tropical flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia and is characterized by its simple, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are often visited by insects, contributing to its role in pollination networks. Vateria lanceolaria is valued in traditional medicine for its potential therapeutic properties.
